```{r loaddata}

raw_data  <- read.csv(file="all_data_eyetracking.csv",head=TRUE) #read data
data_df <- raw_data

```


```{r data cleaning}

data_df        <- data_df %>% filter(subid != 2326) #exclude subject 2326
data_df        <- data_df %>% filter(ACC != 0) #exclude false trials
data_df$headAll  <- data_df$headAll * 1000 #s to ms
data_df        <- data_df %>% filter(!is.na(headAll)) #excluding NA


#Converts variables to factor type
data_df$subid          <- factor(data_df$subid)
data_df$type           <- factor(data_df$type)
data_df$consistency    <- factor(data_df$consistency)

data_df$consistency2   <- factor(data_df$consistency,levels=c('c','i1','i2')) #reorder the levels; consistency2 was computed to avoid errors in emmeans package.

#distribution of the data
hist(data_df$headAll)

```


```{r desrciping data}

#1. how many subjects remained
data_df %>% group_by(subid) %>% summarize() %>% nrow()

#2. how many trials left for each cell
tn <- data_df %>% group_by(subid,consistency,type) %>% summarize(trialn=length(subid)) %>% ungroup()

min(tn$trialn)# check if any condition has too few trials

#3. check the levels of the factors
levels(data_df$type)
levels(data_df$consistency)
levels(data_df$consistency2)

```

2.3 re-coding and scaling predictors
```{r recoding and scaling}

#1. re-coding categorical predictors
# must be Sum instead of sum
contrasts(data_df$type)           <- contr.Sum(levels(data_df$type)) 
contrasts(data_df$consistency)    <- contr.Sum(levels(data_df$consistency))
contrasts(data_df$consistency2)   <- contr.Sum(levels(data_df$consistency2))

#check the new coding approach
contrasts(data_df$type)
contrasts(data_df$consistency)
contrasts(data_df$consistency2)

```

```{r full model}

#fit maximal model first
m2.head.full <- lmer(headAll ~ 1 + type * consistency2 + 
                     (1 + type * consistency2 | subid), 
                     data = data_df,
                     control = lmerControl(optimizer = 'bobyqa',
                                           calc.derivs = F,
                                           optCtrl = list(maxfun = 2e5)))

summary(m2.head.full)
isSingular(m2.head.full) #Check for a singular fit

```

```{r rePCA1}

#Random effects in the model were analyzed using PCA
summary(rePCA(m2.head.full)) # to see how many random effects are needed

model_terms <- model.matrix(m2.head.full)  ### Please, please check the model_terms very very carefully. #see also:  https://rpubs.com/Reinhold/22193 and https://rpubs.com/yjunechoe/correlationsLMEM

p_name   <- colnames(model.matrix(m2.head.full)) 
par_info <- data.frame('number'=c(1:length(p_name)),'names'=p_name)  
# must check the column names and get the right column!!! very very important.

```

```{r full model2}

re_t          <- model.matrix(m2.head.full)[,2] # random effects of type
re_c          <- model.matrix(m2.head.full)[,3] # random effects of consisc
re_i1         <- model.matrix(m2.head.full)[,4] # random effects of consisi1
re_tc         <- model.matrix(m2.head.full)[,5] # random effects of type:c
re_ti1        <- model.matrix(m2.head.full)[,6] # random effects of type:i1

#This should be the same as Full model
m2.head.full2 <- lmer(headAll ~ 1  + type * consistency2 +
                      (1 + re_t + re_c + re_i1 + re_tc + re_ti1| subid), 
                      data = data_df,
                      control = lmerControl(optimizer = 'bobyqa',
                                            calc.derivs = F,
                                            optCtrl = list(maxfun = 2e5)))

summary(m2.head.full2)
#Careful compare with the first full model

```


```{r re2 model}

#PCA suggests that the intercept is sufficient to interpret all the variance
m2.head.re1 <- lmer(headAll ~ 1  + type * consistency2 +
                        (1 | subid), 
                      data = data_df,
                      control = lmerControl(optimizer = 'bobyqa',
                                            calc.derivs = F,
                                            optCtrl = list(maxfun = 2e5)))

summary(m2.head.re1)
isSingular(m2.head.re1)
summary(rePCA(m2.head.re1))
save(m2.head.re1, file = "m2_1res_headAll.RData")

```



```{r test}

#Check for differences between this model and the full model, Ideally there should be no difference
anova(m2.head.re1, m2.head.full, refit = F)

```


```{r sig test}

headAll.sig2 <- mixed(headAll ~ 1  + type * consistency2 +
                        (1 | subid), 
                      data = data_df,
                      method='LRT',
                      check_contrasts = F,
                      control = lmerControl(optimizer = 'bobyqa',
                                            calc.derivs = F,
                                            optCtrl = list(maxfun = 2e5)))

headAll.sig2
save(headAll.sig2, file = "headAll_sig.RData")
#There isn't any significant result

```
